Posts.Content: LouLa wrote: Hello everyone!  I have ordered 2 Elasto-Gel Helmets/Caps for Chemo next Wed.  I would have done the Penguine cold caps but they were way too expensive!  Plus with the Elasto-Gel I have been told by the company that you do not need as many caps.  I would just like to get some feedback from everyone.  Also, I would like to know how all of you cared for your hair during chemo?  Thanks everyone! LouLa Dx 8/22/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anyone tried Elasto-Gel Helmets/Caps? LouLa Laura5

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2011 07:33PM - edited Sep 9, 2011 07:34PM by LouLa Surgery went great! Found out that im BRCA-1 positive. Lymph nodes were clean. Just got home from the hospital. Im going to take it easy. Thank you all for your love, support, and prayers!!! It means so much to me! Thanks

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 11:43PM LouLa wrote: Hi everyone. I would just like to say that I was diagnosed with lyme disease two and a half years ago. I found the lump in my breast almost two years to the day later. I had been on heavy antibiotics for two years (including intravenous). I told my LLMD about the lumps in my breast two years ago and he always said their just cysts you need to take more iodine, so I did. it wasn't until the new lump and my moms breast cancer returning that I insisted my doc send me for an ultrasound.
